triggerPanel.activationHint: Once you’ve finished building your workflow, publish it to have it also listen continuously (you just won’t see those executions here).

properties.name: queue
properties.description: The name of the queue to read from

properties.name: options
properties.description: Whether to save the content as binary

options.name: contentIsBinary
options.description: Whether to save the content as binary

options.name: acknowledge
options.description: After the workflow execution finished. No matter if the execution was successful or not.

options.name: Execution Finishes
options.description: After the workflow execution finished. No matter if the execution was successful or not.

options.name: Execution Finishes Successfully
options.description: After the workflow execution finished successfully

options.name: Immediately
options.description: As soon as the message got received

options.name: Specified Later in Workflow
options.description: Using a RabbitMQ node to remove the item from the queue

options.name: jsonParseBody
options.description: Whether to parse the body to an object

options.name: onlyContent
options.description: Whether to return only the content property

options.name: parallelMessages
options.description: Max number of executions at a time. Use -1 for no limit.

properties.displayName: To delete an item from the queue, insert a RabbitMQ node later in the workflow and use the 'Delete from queue' operation
properties.name: laterMessageNode

notices.name: laterMessageNode
notices.text: To delete an item from the queue, insert a RabbitMQ node later in the workflow and use the 'Delete from queue' operation

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional note to save with the node

notesInFlow.name: Display Note in Flow?
notesInFlow.description: If active, the note above will display in the flow as a subtitle

settings.note: Trigger nodes only have common settings (notes, notesInFlow)
